nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Action Notes
nodes.label: Action Notes

data.reasoning: Manages the workflow of converting unstructured data into structured actions
data.description: Captures and interprets meeting notes to generate actionable insights and trigger relevant agents.
data.role: 1. Capture and interpret meeting transcripts or notes. 2. Summarize the meeting content into concise, actionable insights. 3. Identify key events, such as new life events, goal changes, or new goals, and interpret their implications. 4. Trigger other agents (e.g., Goal Management Agent, Life Event Agent) by providing the necessary details as inputs.
data.underlying_data: Meeting Transcripts/Notes: Captured from Salesforce-integrated meeting tools (e.g., Zoom, Microsoft Teams). Client Profile Data: Access to the client’s existing profile in Salesforce FSC, including life events, goals, and financial plan details.

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Education Planning
nodes.label: Education Planning

data.reasoning: Interacts with Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC) to create or update life events, ensuring accurate data entry and integration with other systems
data.description: Creates or updates life events in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC)
data.role: 1. Take required inputs (e.g., event type, date, associated client) to set up a new Life Event in Salesforce or modify an existing Life Event. 2. Ensure the Life Event is accurately linked to the client’s profile and financial plan in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC). 3. Trigger the Portfolio Monitoring Assistant Agent to update the client’s portfolio status based on the Life Event.
data.underlying_data: Client Profile Data: Access to the client’s existing profile in Salesforce FSC, including current Life Events, goals, and financial plan. Input Data: Required inputs provided by other agents (e.g., Meeting Notes to Actions Agent) or manually by the advisor, such as: Event type (e.g., "Birth of a Child"), Event date, Associated details (e.g., dependent's name, relationship).

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Goal Planning
nodes.label: Goal Planning

data.reasoning: Automates the process of creating or updating financial goals in Salesforce FSC, focusing on data management and integration
data.description: Creates or updates financial goals in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC).
data.role: 1. Take required inputs (e.g., goal type, target amount, time horizon, priority level) to set up a new Goal in Salesforce or modify an existing Goal. 2. Ensure the Goal is accurately linked to the client’s profile and financial plan in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC). 3. Trigger the Portfolio Monitoring Assistant Agent to update the client’s portfolio status based on the new or updated Goal.
data.underlying_data: Client Profile Data: Access to the client’s existing profile in Salesforce FSC, including current goals, life events, and financial plan. Input Data: Required inputs provided by other agents (e.g., Meeting Notes to Actions Agent), such as: Goal type (e.g., "Education Savings"), Target amount, Time horizon (e.g., 10 years), Priority level (e.g., "High Priority").

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Proposal Generator
nodes.label: Proposal Generator

data.reasoning: Orchestrates the workflow for proposal creation
data.description: Consolidates outcomes from various agents to generate a comprehensive proposal report.
data.role: 1. Orchestrate and consolidate the outcomes of the Current Portfolio Assessment Agent and other relevant agents. 2. Generate a comprehensive proposal report that includes portfolio analysis, actionable recommendations, and alignment with the client’s financial goals and strategy. 3. Present the proposal in a professional format that can be shared with the client.
data.underlying_data: Current Portfolio Assessment Outcomes: Summary, projections, and commentary provided by the Current Portfolio Assessment Agent. Client Financial Goals: Goals set or updated by the Set Goal in SF Agent. Portfolio Performance and Benchmarks: Detailed performance metrics and benchmarks fetched by the Fetch PMS Details Agent. Life Events: Relevant life events provided by the Set Life Event in SF Agent that may impact the client’s financial plan. Advisor Recommendations: Advisor’s manual inputs or preferences for the proposal, if applicable.

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Collaboration
nodes.label: Collaboration

data.reasoning: Automates client notifications, selecting appropriate communication channels and ensuring timely delivery of updates
data.description: Notifies clients with updates, alerts, or reports through their preferred communication channels.
data.role: 1. Notify clients with the required details, which may include text messages, PDF reports, or alerts. 2. Determine the most appropriate communication channel (e.g., email, mobile SMS, client portal) based on the client’s preferences and the nature of the notification. 3. Ensure timely and accurate delivery of notifications to enhance client engagement and satisfaction.
data.underlying_data: Client Communication Preferences: Retrieve client preferences for communication channels (e.g., email, SMS, or client portal) stored in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC). Notification Content: Text-based updates, alerts, or reports generated by other agents, such as: Portfolio updates from the Current Portfolio Assessment Agent, Proposal reports from the Agents to Orchestrate, Consolidate & Generate Proposal, Alerts from the Portfolio Monitoring Assistant Agent. Client Profile Data: Contact details (e.g., email address, phone number) and client portal access information stored in Salesforce FSC.

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Scenario Modelling
nodes.label: Scenario Modelling

data.reasoning: Focuses on decision-making and aligning strategies with client goals
data.description: Evaluates and compares various funding options tailored to the client’s financial goals.
data.role: 1. Analyze various funding options available to the client. 2. Evaluate each option based on contributions, tax efficiencies, and associated risks. 3. Provide a comparative analysis to help the client decide on the best combination of funding options tailored to their financial goals and preferences.
data.underlying_data: Client Financial Goals: Goals set by the client (e.g., retirement, education, home purchase) to determine the suitability of funding options. Funding Options: Details of available funding options, such as: 529, Personal savings, Loans or credit facilities, Investment accounts (e.g., 401(k), IRAs, mutual funds), Tax-advantaged accounts (e.g., Health Savings Accounts, education savings plans). Tax Regulations: Relevant tax rules and benefits associated with each funding option, including deductions, exemptions, and tax deferral opportunities. Risk Tolerance: Client-specific risk tolerance to evaluate the risk levels of funding options. Market Data: Current market conditions and interest rates to assess the viability of funding options like loans or investments. Contribution Limits: Contribution limits or caps for tax-advantaged accounts (e.g., annual limits for IRAs or 401(k)s).

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Forecasting
nodes.label: Forecasting

data.reasoning: Focuses on decision-making by analyzing inputs and economic factors
data.description: Projects future education costs and provides insights into funding strategies.
data.role: 1. Gather required input parameters such as university details, time horizon, and other relevant factors. 2. If necessary, connect to university websites or portals to determine current education costs (e.g., tuition, fees, living expenses). 3. Use calculators to project future education costs based on inflation rates and other economic factors. 4. Leverage Copilot by providing prompts to the Large Language Model (LLM) for enhanced insights and integration of responses into the analysis.
data.underlying_data: University Details:University name, location, and program of interest. Current tuition fees, additional costs (e.g., housing, books, transportation). Time Horizon: Number of years until the client or their dependent will begin education. Duration of the program (e.g., 4 years for undergraduate, 2 years for a master's). Inflation and Cost Growth Rates: Historical and projected inflation rates for education costs. Regional variations in cost growth. Client-Specific Inputs: Client’s preferred funding strategy (e.g., savings, loans, scholarships). Risk tolerance and financial goals related to education funding. External Data Sources: University websites or portals for real-time cost data. Publicly available databases or APIs for education cost trends.

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Market Analysis
nodes.label: Market Analysis

data.reasoning: Supports decision-making by providing advisors with relevant updates
data.description: Analyzes financial news to identify risks, trends, and actionable insights.
data.role: 1. Connect to news portals (e.g., Google News Alerts, financial news APIs, or RSS feeds) to fetch relevant news and updates on specific funds or products. 2. Analyze the fetched news to identify potential risks, performance trends, and key insights. 3. Provide actionable analysis to advisors for better decision-making and client communication.
data.underlying_data: News Portals and APIs: Google News Alerts, Financial news platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Yahoo Finance), Fund-specific news from fund houses or asset management companies. Fund/Product Details: Fund name, type, and category. Performance metrics and risk indicators (from the Fund/Product Details Agent). Market Data: Broader market trends and events that may impact fund performance. Sentiment Analysis Data: Positive, negative, or neutral sentiment derived from the news articles.

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Portfolio Monitoring
nodes.label: Portfolio Monitoring

data.reasoning: Interacts with Salesforce FSC to provide real-time alerts
data.description: Monitors client portfolios for changes or events that impact financial plans.
data.role: 1. Continuously monitor all client portfolios associated with the advisor in Salesforce Financial Services Cloud (FSC). 2. Detect changes or events that impact client portfolios, such as new Life Events, new or modified Goals, market fluctuations, or portfolio underperformance. 3. Alert the advisor in real-time on their mobile device or within Salesforce, highlighting the impacted portfolio and the specific area of impact.
data.underlying_data: Client Portfolio Data: Comprehensive portfolio details for each client, including asset allocation, performance metrics, and risk levels. Life Events and Goals: Updates from the Set Life Event in SF Agent and Set Goal in SF Agent to assess their impact on the portfolio. Market Data: External financial market data (e.g., stock prices, interest rates, and economic indicators) to identify market-driven portfolio risks. Advisor Preferences: Customizable thresholds and preferences set by the advisor for alerts (e.g., "Notify me if portfolio performance drops below X%").

nodes.id: agent::Life Event Based::Parenthood::Education Funding::Reports Generator
nodes.label: Reports Generator

data.reasoning: Generates detailed portfolio summary reports, presenting insights and metrics in a professional format for client communication
data.description: Generates a detailed report summarizing portfolio performance and alignment with goals.
data.role: 1. Generate a detailed Portfolio Summary Report using the outcomes of the Current Portfolio Assessment Agent. 2. Present the report in a professional and structured format, including key insights, performance metrics, and alignment with client goals. 3. Provide the report in a shareable format (e.g., PDF) for advisors to review and share with clients.
data.underlying_data: Current Portfolio Assessment Outcomes: Portfolio summary, projections, and commentary generated by the Current Portfolio Assessment Agent. Client Financial Goals: Goals set or updated by the Set Goal in SF Agent, which are used to evaluate portfolio alignment. Performance Metrics and Benchmarks: Detailed performance data and benchmarks fetched by the Fetch PMS Details Agent. Life Events: Relevant life events provided by the Set Life Event in SF Agent that may impact the portfolio or financial goals.

data.reasoning: Performs a specialized analytical function (providing projections, evaluating outcomes), akin to a dedicated expert role within the system
data.description: Provides projections for future portfolio performance and evaluates potential outcomes under different market conditions.
data.role: 1. Uses historical data and market trends to generate forecasts for portfolio performance. 2. Runs scenario analyses to evaluate how the portfolio would perform under various conditions (e.g., economic downturns, interest rate changes). 3. Provides recommendations for adjustments based on forecast insights.
data.underlying_data: Historical performance data: Asset-level and portfolio-level historical returns and volatility. Market trends: Economic forecasts, sector performance, and interest rate projections. Client goals: Target returns and timelines for achieving financial goals. Risk parameters: Stress-testing scenarios (e.g., economic downturns, market crashes). Portfolio allocation: Current and proposed allocation for scenario modeling.

nodes.id: agent::Advisor Journey Based::Monitoring, Optimization & Adjustments::Portfolio Modeling and Strategy Adjustments::Rebalancing Agent
nodes.label: Rebalancing Agent

data.reasoning: Automates performance analysis and recommends adjustments, embodying a strategic, decision-making role focused on optimizing a specific domain
data.description: Automates portfolio performance analysis and recommends adjustments.
data.role: 1. Evaluates portfolio performance against benchmarks and client goals. 2. Conducts risk assessments and stress tests to identify vulnerabilities. 3. Suggests rebalancing strategies and asset replacements to optimize performance.
data.underlying_data: Portfolio data: Current asset allocation (e.g., equities, bonds, cash, alternatives), holdings (e.g., stock symbols, fund names, real estate properties). Performance metrics: Historical returns, risk-adjusted returns, and benchmark comparisons. Market data: Real-time data on asset prices, interest rates, and economic indicators. Risk profile: David’s risk tolerance and any changes in his preferences. Investment constraints: Exclusions (e.g., ethical investing, avoiding certain sectors). Diversification metrics: Asset class, sector, and geographic diversification.

nodes.id: agent::Advisor Journey Based::Monitoring, Optimization & Adjustments::Alerts, notifications on changes to the portfolio::Collaboration
nodes.label: Collaboration

data.workflow: Alerts, notifications on changes to the portfolio
data.reasoning: Monitors events and sends timely alerts, indicating a clear role in managing and executing a communication-based workflow or process
data.description: Monitors portfolio changes and market events, sending timely alerts to the advisor and client.
data.role: 1. Tracks portfolio performance and market conditions in real time. 2. Sends automated alerts for significant changes (e.g., asset value drops, allocation shifts). 3. Provides actionable recommendations in the notifications.
data.underlying_data: Portfolio thresholds: Defined triggers for alerts (e.g., asset value drops by 10%, allocation shifts beyond 5%). Market events: Economic indicators, interest rate changes, geopolitical events. Real-time portfolio data: Current portfolio value, asset performance, and allocation. Notification preferences: David’s preferred communication channels (e.g., email, SMS, app notifications).

nodes.id: agent::Advisor Journey Based::Monitoring, Optimization & Adjustments::Visualization & Reporting::Insights
nodes.label: Insights

data.reasoning: Automates the creation of reports and visualizations, indicating a direct interaction with the system's data processing and output functionalities to present information
data.description: Automates the creation of portfolio performance reports and visualizations.
data.role: 1. Generates performance reports with metrics like ROI, risk-adjusted returns, and benchmark comparisons. 2. Creates visual dashboards with charts and graphs to simplify data interpretation. 3. Shares reports with clients via email or a secure portal.
data.underlying_data: Portfolio performance: ROI, risk-adjusted returns, and benchmark comparisons. Asset allocation: Current and historical allocation across asset classes, sectors, and geographies. Goal progress: Comparison of portfolio performance with David’s financial goals. Historical data: Performance trends over time (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annually).
